spoken-english-week11_key1:
Hello!! 
This is your Class 11 for Spoken English course module.
spoken-english-week11_key5: Why is it your favorite festival ?
spoken-english-week11_key6: What do you do during the festival ?
spoken-english-week11_key7: What is the importance of that festival ?
spoken-english-week11_key9:
The objective of this activity is to introduce or revisit tenses SIMPLE TENSES.
You can start with explaining what is a tense, and the difference between the simple tenses - Past, Present, Future.
What is a tense: A tense is a verb that helps us
understand time in grammar.
Past Tense - Things that already happened
Present Tense - Things that are happening now
Future Tense - Things that are going to happen.
spoken-english-week11_key10:
The main function of a verb is to indicate when the action happens. There are three main verb tenses; 
past, present and future. Each tense is divided into; simple, continuous, perfect and perfect continuous. In this lesson, we will only focus on the simple tenses in the past, present and future.
The present tense of a verb is the 'original' form. The past tense can have different patterns. The future simple is formed with 'will'.
You can use the following `statements` to practice with the student. Point out how a correct word or phrase can be used to show the time of the action along with
the verb. Example: yesterday, today, later, tomorrow, a year from now etc.
spoken-english-week11_key12: I had a shower yesterday. (Past simple)
spoken-english-week11_key13: I have a shower every day. (Present simple)
spoken-english-week11_key14: I will have a shower later. (Future simple)
spoken-english-week11_key16: I ran five kilometres yesterday. (Past simple)
spoken-english-week11_key18: I will run tomorrow morning. (Future simple)
spoken-english-week11_key19: *It is important to remember that in the Present simple with ‘he’, ‘she’, and ‘it’ add an ‘s’ to the verb.
spoken-english-week11_key23: He will like the party. (Future simple)
spoken-english-week11_key24: Exercise 1: Identify the verb followed by the tense.
spoken-english-week11_key25: They searched far and wide. (searched – simple past tense)
spoken-english-week11_key26: I will rescue the child. (will rescue – simple future tense)
spoken-english-week11_key27: The children chased the dogs. (chased – simple past tense)
spoken-english-week11_key28: The sun will get hotter and hotter at the center. (will get – simple future tense)
spoken-english-week11_key29: She recognized him at once. (recognized – simple past)
spoken-english-week11_key30: I have a dog and a cat. (have -simple present)
spoken-english-week11_key31: Exercise 2: Fill in the blanks with correct tense:
spoken-english-week11_key35:
I _____ Chris at the party this evening. 
Verb: Eat
spoken-english-week11_key37: She ____ lunch at the restaurant near her office everyday.
spoken-english-week11_key39:
Verb: Know (Give the student the tense and ask
for the correct form of the verb)
spoken-english-week11_key40:
I _____ her when I was a child. (Past simple -
Knew)
spoken-english-week11_key42: I ______ what to do later. (Future simple- will know)
spoken-english-week11_key43:
Verb: Cook (Give the student the tense and ask for
the correct form of the verb)
spoken-english-week11_key46: I _____ dinner tomorrow. (Future simple: will cook)
spoken-english-week11_key48:
Create (verb)
Meaning : to make something new, or invent something:
spoken-english-week11_key50:
He created a wonderful meal from very few
ingredients.
spoken-english-week11_key51:
The new business will create hundreds of jobs in the
area.
spoken-english-week11_key53:
Pair and Share:
5. What is your favorite festival ?
6. Why is it your favorite festival ?
7. What do you do during the festival ?
8. What is the importance of that festival ?

spoken-english-week11_key102:
Examples:
These plants thrive with relatively little sunlight
spoken-english-week11_key106:
Example:
The dog is thriving in its new home.
Our new business selling soap is thriving due to the
current situation.
